title: EventProperties
description: The properties commonly used by Nova. Additional properties can be added at will
$comment: Please get familiar with the pest practices sending Business Events using the Segment format before adding arbitrary properties

org_phone.description: The phone number used to start the action (caller or origin of an sms).

dst_phone.description: The target phone number for the action (being called or items being sent to.

rsp_phone.description: The phone number responsible for the action being taken (the parent phone number).

org_email_address.description: The email address responsible for starting the action (sent from).

customer.description: The customer primarily involved in the action.

resp_customer.description: The customer indirectly involved in the action. (Company for an employee or parent for a child)

notification.description: A notification being sent or being received.

regarding.description: The CRM entity that the action is regarding.

service.description: The Nova service that the action is regarding.

done_by.description: The Nova employee initiating the action.

authored_by.description: The Nova employee authoring the action .

device.description: The device/equipment that this action responds to.

payment.description: The payment involved in the action.

order.description: The order involved in the action.

operator.description: The carrier that this event message is sent for (Identify virtual operator under Nova).

legacy_type_id.description: If this event had an ID then this is the legacy ID for the the event/event-type

Phone.description: Used to define a phone number with the option of keeping fairly detailed information about it.

type.description: The type of phone number (landline or mobile)

carrier.description: Information about the carrier responsible for the phone number and the home-region for the phone.

location.description: The current location of the phone number (country or more details)

Customer.description: A customer record is used for each individual customer but currently the customer ID can be email, phone-number, social-security-nr or CRM ID
Customer.$comment: Subsystems are only responsible to provide the available 'handle' for a customer and need to rely on de-duplication and correct resolution elsewhere

id.description: The ID of the customer used natively in the origin system

crm_id.description: The CRM ID of the customer

ssn.description: The social security number of the customer

details.description: The traits/details of the customer using the segment.com schema for customer traits

address.$comment: Redundant with the Trait address  if we decide to use that solely.

parent_customer.description: The parent customer of this customer. (if this is a division or child)

Correspondence.description: Generic content container for any type of correspondence

method.description: Method used to send the correspondence.

type.description: Correspondence type if this is a standard correspondence ('other' if it is not).

subject.description: The subject line/title for the correspondence.

media_type.description: Used if the payload content is not text/html

filename.description: Used if the content needs to be downloadable as a specific file

Service.description: Used to define a telecommunication service referred to by Business Events.

id.description: The ID of the telcom service used by the origin system.

sku.description: The publicly visible ID for the telcom service (Customer facing).

name.description: The name of the telcom service

type.description: The core type of the telcom service

variant.description: The variant of the service (Rate plane or main distinction)

category.description: Product/Service category that the service belongs to

tags.description: Various tags used to classify the service

Product.description: Product definition used for other products than teleco services. (Phones, Routers etc.)

product_id.description: Product id displayed on the list

sku.description: Sku of the product being viewed

name.description: Name of the product being viewed

price.description: Price ($) of the product being viewed

Carrier.description: Carrier definition with heretical structure and location information

id.description: The ID of the carrier as used by the origin system

name.description: The name of the carrier as used by the origin system

handle.description: the slug, handle or alternative ID for the carrier as used publicly

details.description: The traits/details of the carrier using the segment.com schema for customer traits

location.description: The primary location of the carrier ot this subsidiary of the carrier

parent_carrier.description: The parent carrier of this carrier. (if this is a division or child)

Equipment.description: Used to attach activity feed entries to equipment and to provide details regarding the equipment.

mac.description: The mac address of the equipment.

brand.description: The brand of the equipment manufacturer.

make.description: The make is the primary product name.

model.description: The model is the secondary product name (variant).

location.description: The primary location of the equipment if stationary.

details.description: The traits/details of the employee using the segment.com schema for customer traits

Location.description: Used to define location of and event or any 'owning' Business Entity. Location can be specified in any detail but country is the minimum requirement.

customer.description: The customer primarily involved in the action.
